summary: This bill, the "Restore M–44 Act," directs the Secretary of the Interior and the Secretary of Agriculture to rescind a memorandum of understanding (MOU) concerning wildlife damage management. It specifically addresses the use of M–44 sodium cyanide ejector devices and related substances. Furthermore, the bill removes a restriction imposed by the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2024, enabling the Secretary of Agriculture to purchase, deploy, and train third parties in the use of these devices. It also removes the requirement of providing updates regarding the implementation of the directive prohibiting the purchase or training related to M-44 devices with Congressional committees.
